meanings.definition: The action of forming or process of being formed.
meanings.sent1: The formations of the clay pots were carefully crafted by the skilled potter.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the rock formations to understand how they were created.
meanings.sent3: The formations of clouds in the sky looked like fluffy animals playing.
meanings.sent4: The formations of stars in the night sky sparkled like diamonds scattered on black velvet.
meanings.sent5: The formations of crystals in the cave glistened in the dim light, creating a magical atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A particular arrangement or pattern of elements.
meanings.sent1: The dance formations of the performers on stage were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The formations of books on the shelf were organized by genre.
meanings.sent3: The formations of colorful balloons at the party added a festive touch.
meanings.sent4: The formations of trees in the forest created a natural canopy overhead.
meanings.sent5: The formations of sand dunes in the desert shifted with the wind, constantly changing the landscape.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things assembled in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: The military formations marched in perfect synchronization during the parade.
meanings.sent2: The formations of students in the classroom were arranged by seating chart.
meanings.sent3: The formations of toys on the shelves made the room look cluttered but cozy.
meanings.sent4: The formations of birds in the sky moved like a graceful ballet performance.
meanings.sent5: The formations of flowers in the garden bloomed in a riot of colors, attracting butterflies and bees.
